title: (ECC) Engineering and Computing Community
description: Engineering or computer science students who are interested in making connections outside the classroom are welcome to join the ECC!

title: 650 Lincoln
description: An on-campus partner apartment complex, close to retail and the STWFC with a resort-style pool, state-of-the-art clubroom and private study spaces on each floor.

title: 820 Henderson
description: A tight-knit apartment community and a building full of Southern charm.

title: Academic Team
description: THE go-to organization here at USC for all your Quiz Bowl needs. Anyone with any knowledge in Science, Math, Technology, Literature, History, or Pop Culture and a desire to let that knowledge bloom and grow is welcome to join.

title: Active Minds
description: Active Minds at USC is a student run non-profit organization that promotes mental health awareness, education, and advocacy.

title: Advocates Against Alzheimerâ€™s
description: Advocates Against Alzheimer's at UofSC is a student run organization focused on Service, Advocacy, and Philanthropy to aid in the fight to find a cure for Alzheimer's.

title: Advocates for Autoimmune Disease
description: "We See You". Advocating for Invisible Illnesses. As a group, we will plan events and participate in community events located in Columbia, SC as well as advocate for a variety of autoimmune diseases.

title: Advocates for Life
description: The only specifically pro-life organization on campus, dedicated to fostering respect for human life at all stages of development, from conception to natural death, through education and action.

title: Alliance for Women in STEM
description: Alliance for Women in STEM provides a community for women with a passion for science, technology, engineering, and mathematics. All female students studying STEM fields, social sciences, and medicine are encouraged and welcome to join.

title: Alpha Alpha Alpha
description: Tri-Alpha is the National Honor Society for First-Generation college students. The Alpha Psi Chapter at USC has a goal to recognize the first generation college students and assist them to gain a successful college experience for their thriving career.

title: Alpha Chi Omega
description: We are a women's organization that enriches the lives of members through lifetime opportunities for friendship, leadership, learning, and service.

title: Alpha Delta Pi
description: Established in 1851, Alpha Delta Pi is committed to sisterhood, values and ethics, high academic standards and social responsibility. The Beta Epsilon Chapter is one of the largest chapters of Alpha Delta Pi in the nation.

title: Alpha Epsilon Delta
description: AED aims to mentor pre-health students as they pursue careers in healthcare by providing them with opportunities to gain valuable clinical exposure, network with professionals, be recognized for scholastic achievements, and serve the local community.

title: Alpha Epsilon Pi
description: Providing opportunities for the college man seeking the best possible college and fraternity experience.

title: Alpha Gamma Delta
description: Alpha Gamma Delta is an international fraternity for women that exists to provide opportunities for personal development through the spirit of sisterhood.

title: Alpha Kappa Alpha Sorority, Incorporated
description: Our purpose is to cultivate and encourage high scholastic and ethical standards, to promote unity and friendship, help alleviate problems concerning girls and women, to maintain a progressive interest in college life, and to be of service to all mankind.

title: Alpha Kappa Psi
description: Alpha Kappa Psi is recognized as the premier developer of principled business leaders. We are the oldest and largest business fraternity in the world, and we are open to ALL majors!

title: Alpha Lambda Delta
description: Honor society for students, made available to freshman who have achieved academic excellence during their first semester.

title: Alpha Omega
description: We are a non-denominational Christian group whose overall purpose is to offer anyone on campus the opportunity to be involved in Bible study and to gain a deeper understanding of what it means to be a Christian in today's society.

title: Alpha Omega Epsilon
description: Alpha Omega Epsilon is a professional and social sorority for women in STEM disciplines

title: Alpha Phi Alpha Fraternity, Inc.
description: We are a social, community service based organization that operates under the tenets of manly deeds, scholarship, and love for all mankind.

title: Alpha Phi Omega
description: Alpha Phi Omega is a national service organization founded through the principles of Leadership, Friendship and Service that we are architects of our own ambitions and that each of us has the opportunity to develop ourselves to be whatever we seek to be.

title: Alpha Sigma Phi
description: Established in 1845, Alpha Sigma Phi stands by the motto "To Better the Man". We are a social fraternity focused on brotherhood, philanthropies, and leadership. With five core values we hold ourselves to, patriotism, silence, charity, honor, and purity.

title: Alpha Sigma Rho Sorority, Inc.
description: The first Asian-interest sorority at the University of South Carolina.

title: Alpha Xi Delta
description: Alpha Xi Delta is a women's fraternal organization founded in 1893. Alpha Xi Delta is committed to its four pillars: sisterhood, leadership, knowledge, and service.

title: American Chemical Society Student Chapter
description: The American Chemical Society Student Chapter promotes the chemical sciences providing seminars from professional chemists, participating in community science outreach, and encouraging undergraduate research in chemistry and biochemistry.

title: American Civil Liberties Union (Columbia College Chapter)
description: The American Civil Liberties Union actively defends the civil liberties of all students. We fight for equality & human rights. Check us out!

title: American Institute of Aeronautics and Astronautics
description:
-Educate members about aeronautics/astronautics
-Network with industry professionals
-Gain hands-on experience with engineering projects

Join our groupme: https://groupme.com/join_group/19780430/wXzZHa

title: American Institute of Chemical Engineers
description: We strive to connect chemical engineering students at the University of South Carolina with professionals, other students, and professors; to serve the community in which we operate; and to organize professional development opportunities for our members.

title: American Marketing Association
description:
Welcome to the AMA! Feel free to email us at amasouthcarolina@gmail.com and follow us on Instagram @uofscama. 
We are the only marketing association that connects professional marketers and marketing students across the nation!

title: American Nuclear Society, Student Chapter
description: Our goals as a student organization are to provide a networking pathway between USC students and local industry professionals, coordinate nuclear facility tours, and facilitate communication about current topics in nuclear engineering.

title: American Pharmacists Association Academy of Student Pharmacists
description: The mission of the APhA Academy of Student Pharmacists (APhA-ASP) is to be the collective voice of student pharmacists, to provide opportunities for professional growth, to improve patient care, and to envision and advance the future of pharmacy.

title: American Physician Scientist Association
description: The American Physician Scientist Association is devoted to promoting medical research and to supporting students on their journey to a career involving research as a health care professional.

title: American Sign Language Club
description: To promote interest in American Sign Language as well as to practice using and understanding sign language.

title: American Society for Biochemistry and Molecular Biology Chapter
description: This university-based chapter is dedicated to the advancement of the sciences of biochemistry and molecular biology, focusing on professional development, resume building, community outreach, and sharing experiences with fellow classmates.

title: American Society of Civil Engineers
description: The American Society of Civil Engineers represents more than 150,000 members of the civil engineering profession in 177 countries. The goal of this chapter is to engage Civil Engineering students in their profession early on.

title: American Society of Mechanical Engineers
description: The purpose of ASME is to connect engineering students with local professionals and companies in order to pursue career opportunities.

title: Anglers
description: ANGLERS is the University of South Carolina's official competitive bass fishing team offering an extra-curricular organization that provides a learning environment in the field of competitive fishing. The Anglers club competes in BASS and MLF competition

title: Anthropology Graduate Organization for Research, Action and Ethics
description: To further research, action and ethical objectives of the graduate students in the Anthropology Department.

title: Anthropology Student Association
description: Promotes and supports student interests, research and activities in the field of anthropology.

title: Arab Student Association
description: The Arab Student Association is an organization where Arab students at UofSC can come together and share in their collective identities. Non-Arab students are also more than welcome to join and immerse themselves in the diversity of Arab culture.

title: Arnold Air Society William Glover Farrow Squadron
description: To provide additional leadership opportunities to cadets to prepare them for corps leadership with AFROTC.  We also have a sister organization, Silver Wings, in which non-ROTC college students can start networking for jobs related to national defense.

title: Art Therapy Club
description: The Art Therapy Club's goal is to create a relaxing, stress-free environment for students. Meetings will include an art-themed activity such as crafts, drawing, painting, or other forms of art.

title: ASDA Pre-Dental Club
description: The ASDA Pre-Dental Club aims to provide students interested in the dental field an exposure to oral health through workshops, volunteer opportunities, research, and shadowing experiences.

title: Aspiring Pre-Health Student Mentoring Initiative
description: APSMI provides mentorship and guidance to high-school students considering pursuing a career in the medical field. We aim to make the path towards being a healthcare provider more manageable and accessible to all.

title: Association for Computing Machinery
description: The Association for Computing Machinery is an international learned society for computing. It was founded in 1947 and is the world's largest scientific and educational computing society.

title: Association for Information Systems
description: The Association for Information Systems is an organization focused on professional development and networking for students looking to work in the field of technology.

title: Association for Women in Mathematics
description: AWM is a student organization that supports women in STEM fields, specifically mathematics. The goal of our organization is to promote and educate women on their options and career paths of women in math as well as provide a supporting network on campus.

title: Association of African American Students
description: Provides positive cultural, intellectual and social activities for all students at USC.

title: Association of Public Health Infectious Disease Students
description: APHIDS is aimed towards any student of any year or major interested in infectious diseases. We discuss different diseases, provide field opportunities, support infectious disease-related causes, and assist in professional development.

title: Association of Saudi Arabian Students
description: Association of Saudi Arabian Students at USC is an organization that promotes cultural awareness of the Saudi Culture, and connects the Saudi community in SC.

title: Association of Transfer Students
description: The Association of Transfer Students is a student organization for transfer students created by transfer students.

title: Astrology Club
description: This club is for students who are interested in learning more/ discussing astrology. We are all here to teach each other things, so people with no knowledge on the subject are still more than welcome to join! Helpful to know your birth place and time!

title: Astronomy Club
description: We are a group of astronomy enthusiasts providing a community to observe the night sky and share or learn new information related to astronomy.

title: Balanced Beauty
description: The purpose of this skin organization is to help minority men and women on campus establish a balance between their outer and inner beauty through Skin Care, Self Care, and Wellness practices.

title: Bangladesh Student Association
description: BSA is a non-political and non-profit student organization working in the best interest of the Bangladeshi students at University of South Carolina.

title: Baptist Collegiate Ministry
description: Carolina BCM seeks to spread the gospel to every student, help students grow in their faith, and send out students to fulfill the great comission.

title: Bates House
description: A one-of-a-kind residence hall community with in-building academic resources and an all-you-can-eat diner.

title: Bates West
description: An apartment-style hall with a convenient nearby parking lot for residents and an all-you-can-eat diner next door.

title: Be the Match on Campus
description: Be The Match on Campus is a community of donors and volunteers who work to help patients receive life-saving bone marrow or stem cell donations. Please join us in working to help Americans fighting blood-based diseases. You could save a life!

title: Best Buddies
description: Enhances the lives of people with intellectual or developmental disabilities by providing for new friendships with college students and allowing for integrative opportunities.

title: Beta Alpha Psi
description: Promoting the study and practice of accounting, providing opportunities for self-development and association among members and practicing accountants, and encouraging a sense of ethical, social, and public responsibility.

title: Beta Beta Beta
description: Beta Beta Beta (TriBeta) is a national professional society for students dedicated to improving the understanding and appreciation of biological study as well as extending the boundaries of scientific knowledge through research.

title: Beta Theta Pi
description: We provide a values based experience which aids the individual, builds the Fraternity and strengthens the academic institution through lifelong devotion to cultivation of the intellect, mutual assistance, trust, integrity, and responsible conduct.

title: BioMed Engineering Society
description: We are the USC Chapter of the Biomedical Engineering Society. Our vision is to serve as the world's leading society of professionals devoted to developing and using engineering and technology to advance human health and well-being.

title: Black and Abroad Gamecocks
description: Our purpose is to promote global educational experiences among underserved populations on campus.

title: Black Association for Psychology Students
description: The purpose of this organization is to create a platform for black and minority psychology students to be successful by allowing them to network and participate in service opportunities.

title: Black Business Student Association
description: BBSA is an organization intended to help provide support to minority students. We aim to build unity by supporting the academic and professional achievements of minority business students.

title: Black Capstone Caucus
description: Our purpose is to provide a space for high-achieving Black students to unapologetically be themselves, cultivate a cohort of extraordinary campus leaders, provide fellowship opportunities, & make a noticeable impact on the Capstone & Carolina community!

title: Black Graduate Student Association
description: To foster a sense of community among Black graduate and professional students at the University of South Carolina.
